page.title: 06FARMING - ETTRICK VALLEY
page.content: Farmland in Ettrick Valley is mainly grades 6 & 7 and consists of steep rough grazing with a small percentage of workable fields mainly beside the River Ettrick which runs across this section. The ground height is 700 ft. to l500ft. Of the six farms in this area, one belongs to the Forestry Commission and is given over to conifers. The others, classified as less favoured areas are stocked with sheep and beef cattle. Farm Animals - The farms are stocked with the hardy cheviot sheep or the Scottish blackfaced sheep and the cattle are beef-type cows out wintering and single suckling. Lambs and calves are sold in the Autumn at the store sales where they are bought by farmers from low ground to fatten for the market.
